sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The western wonder, or, O Brazeel, an inchanted island discovered with a relation of two ship-wracks in a dreadful sea-storm in that discovery : to which is added, a description of a place, called, Montecapernia, relating the nature of the people, their qualities, humours, fashions, religions, &c. Head, Richard, 1637?-1686?
[4], 40 p.
Printed for N.C., London : 1674.
Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library. Attributed to Richard Head. cf. NUC pre-1956. A satire on Ireland and Wales.
=======

Head, Richard, 1637?-1686?
[4], 40 p.
Printed for N.C., London : 1674.
Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library. Attributed to Richard Head. cf. NUC pre-1956. A satire on Ireland and Wales.
